p: Furthermore, there are few studies on seasonal variations of the antioxidant properties of medicinal plants. Galasso et al. [ 11] reported a significant change in the reducing power of Thymus longicaulis C. Presl extracts at various harvesting times. The seasonal variations of the antioxidant activity were similar to TPC and TFC ( Figure 4). Indeed, the extracts yielded in summer and winter, especially in January and July, with higher levels of flavonoid compounds including flavones and flavanols, showed a higher antiradical power ( Figure 2).
